message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.MA, cs.RO 

The paper proposes an algorithm for reinforcement learning in factored Markov decision processes (FMDPs), which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (AI). The algorithm involves maintaining an empirical model of the FMDP and following a greedy policy with respect to the model. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.AI sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves analyzing the convergence and complexity of the algorithm, which are topics typically studied in the cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.DS (data structures and algorithms) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of the algorithm in multi-agent settings (MA), which is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on optimization and decision-making suggests that it may also belong to the cs.RO (robotics) sub-category.
